rooms.Name: the VIP suite
rooms.Description:
Wow, and you thought the deluxe suite was a room palace...this
suite is twice that size and more.  The bed here looks like a
triple king-size and the holo-screen television has a life-size
projection!  The window view is great -- even though it's only a
pseudo-holographic image of Neptune's atmosphere.  The carpet
looks very clean and there's not even a speck of dirt on it.  As
you look across the room, there's a man here working at a desk.
He must be the VIP inthis room and judging by the clothes he's
wearing, he must be a high-ranking official.

rooms.Name: a rocky path
rooms.Description:
This road is more of an obstacle than something you would walk
on.  The large rocks block your path and the small ones trip you as
you walk.  You are annoyed by the heat in this Martian atmosphere.
There's nothing here but mountains, rocks, and sand.  No sign of
life anywhere.  Heck, this place is boring as hell.  The path
continues east.

rooms.Name: along the rocky path
rooms.Description:
Rocks and a lot of sand -- that's the only thing you can say to
describe Mars.  The place is virtually a desert area.  No water, no 
plant life...  You wonder how life could have started on a planet
filled with inorganic matter.  The path continues east.

rooms.Name: end of the rocky path
rooms.Description:
*Phew*  The heat is merciless.  Luckily for you, the rocky path
ends here.  Your feet are sore from having to step on rocks and
tripping over them.  You are sweating profusely and was about to
faint if you had to go any further.  There's a sign here, posted
on a large wooden stake.
A large sign is posted here...(GLOWING)

ExtraDescs.Description:
*  Hello Outworlder, please go SOUTH of here to visit our mineral
   mines.  The Overseers will tend to your needs.

*  WARNING!  PLEASE DO NOT GO NORTHEAST OF HERE!  THOSE MINES
   ARE UNEXPLORED AREAS.  WE WILL NOT BE HELD ACCOUNTABLE IF
   YOU CHOSE TO GO THERE.

rooms.Name: the Martian mining camp
rooms.Description:
The camp here is nicely set up.  This place looks more like a
small town than a mining camp.  The Overseers greet you with open
arms as you walk into their campsite.  They are here to show you
how they mine their precious minerals.  You are amazed by the light
that's being emitted from those caves.  There must be tons of raw
minerals that have not been mined.  You wonder to yourself, who's
mining these precious gems and stones.  And to your surprise, the
"civilize" Martians actually uses slave labor to mine their
minerals.  However, they don't seem to care what the people from
the other worlds think of their "employment" system.  You can go
back from where you came if you don't like to see people 
suffering.  The mining camps are directly south of here if you
want to continue your "pleasure" tour.

rooms.Name: the Martian slave mines
rooms.Description:
Slaves are everywhere in this cramped mine.  You can see the Overseers
whipping these poor workers.  You are disgusted by the bloody whips
that the Overseers are wielding.  This is no pleasure tour at all.
the workers here will die very soon from exhaustion and the constant
beating.  There are more mine areas to the east.

rooms.Name: more Martian slave mines
rooms.Description:
You can sense more pain, more suffering as the slaves here are
being forced to work day and night for their masters.  The
Overseers would not allow any slave to stop their labor unless
he/she dies.  The large precious stones are being hauled by
the truckload.  It's beginning to get harder to breath because of
this cramped space.  There are more mines south and west of here.

rooms.Name: the slave quarters
rooms.Description:
It smells very bad in here.  No, it's not the smell you expect
from not taking a shower in a week.  It's more like the smell of
rotting corpses and fecal matter combined.  Most of the slaves 
here are either dead or half-dead.  There's a slave doctor here
that can only give minimal care for each worker.

rooms.Name: more Martian slave mines
rooms.Description:
The slaves are working hard just to stay alive for another day.
The Overseers are relentless in their efforts to push the
slaves to mine more minerals.  You can hear the moaning and the
cries of endless pain from the slaves.

rooms.Name: an unexplored Martian area
rooms.Description:
You're walking on a path where no Martian has gone before.  What
the heck do you think you're doing, you ask yourself.  There's
nothing different about this path from the rocky path that you
came from.  But there's darkness ahead of you if you want to go
any further Northeast of here.  Are you willing to risk your life
for foolish curiosity?

rooms.Name: along a dark, unexplored path
rooms.Description:
Where's the light?  The tall mountains here have just covered any
light that will help you see your way around.  It's total 
darkness everywhere.  Even if you had a light-source with you,
there's no way you can see what's ahead of you!

rooms.Name: further along a dark, unexplored path
rooms.Description:
You sense danger everywhere!  Something is moving in the
darkness.  It sounds like an animal of some sort...  But here, on
Mars, no way...right?  Something horrible is definitely hiding
in the darkness and it sounds like it's about to attack!  You
wish you knew what you are up against but this beast is nowhere
to be seen.  Even your artificial light can't sense it's presence.
Time to RUN!!!

rooms.Name: an underground Martian cave
rooms.Description:
You're in a dark, dark cave.  It's darker than the path outside.
You can sense something is moving in this darkness.  There's life
in this cave...  Glowing eyes are everywhere as you walk inside this
large, unexplored cave.  You can see a path that's slanted 
downwards -- it'll take you deeper and deeper into the unknown.

rooms.Name: further into the Martian cave
rooms.Description:
Egads!  Something just passed by your legs.  It feels like a
large furry rodent and sounds like an angry lion.  This doesn't
look good...  You sense you will be attacked before you can go
any further into the cave.  If you're smart, it would be wise to
go back.  The dark and dangerous path continues downward sloping.

rooms.Name: deeper into the Martian cave
rooms.Description:
You're beginning to get cramps on your legs from all that walking.
You can feel your bruises bleeding from tripping on rocks.  The
hostile lifeforms in this cave is constantly trying to kill you
for food.  You sense that your journey will come to an end very
soon.  The path continues downwards.

rooms.Name: the deepest region of the Martian Cave
rooms.Description:
The path doesn't seem to slope downwards any more.  There's no
turning back now...  Your entrance from whence you came is too
far away and you would have to fight off those hungry creatures.
Suddenly, you hear a very loud sound coming from the north.  It
sounds like dynamite exploding.  There's a lot of activities 
going on in the northern section of this cave.  It doesn't sound
like any primitive animals.  It sounds more like people mining
down here...how could that be?  This mine is suppose to be 
unexplored?  The Martian cave continues north.

rooms.Name: an underground mining camp
rooms.Description:
Still there is darkness but your eyes are beginning to get
adjusted to it.  You can see the sparks coming from mining
equipments but you can't see who's operating them.  Then
suddenly, one of the miners detect your presence!  He turns his
head and removes his mask...ackkk!!!  He is no Martian, he
doesn't have green skin.  They must be the subterranean 
ancestors of the Martians -- the Dalaxians.  Watch Out!  They're
dangerous!  Unlike the surface Martians, the Dalaxians are
borned evil.  Go back before they attack!  There's a large
tent to the north of here.

rooms.Name: inside a large tent
rooms.Description:
Unlike the surface Martians, the Dalaxians do not require light
to accomplish their tasks.  As you walk into this large tent, you
can hear the Dalaxians talking.  They're planning on some kind of
project.  This must be the plan room for their operations.  Hmmm,
what could they be planning? -- you think to yourself -- too bad
you don't understand Dalaxian...
The Dalaxians that surround the table look important.  One of 
them is really BIG and the other wears some nice, fancy clothes.

rooms.Name: the RESTRICTED area of Mars
rooms.Description:
There are two reasons why you would enter this area -- because 
you're stupid or you have a deathwish.  THis is the path to the
royal palace.  No one is allowed to walk on this road and now,
you would be treated as an assassin trying to harm the emperor.
You can see the Martian guards surround you, blocking you from 
going any further.  They don't look nice.  They're pointing their
rayguns right at you.  You're in BIG trouble, sport.  The Restricted
path continues south.

rooms.Name: along the Restricted path
rooms.Description:
This path is unlike all the other roads on Mars.  It's more paved
and even.  There are no large rocks that'll block your path and
no stones that you can trip on.  This road was made for a king.
Guards are on your tail.  You may be able to kill one or two but
what can you do against an entire Martian army?  Every guard you
pass, they will try to attack you.  They only way to escape them
is to run.  Run to your destination where ever that may be.
This path continues south.

rooms.Name: an intersection of two roads
rooms.Description:
You've survived the onslaught of the Martian army but they're 
still coming.  There's no sanctuary here that'll protect you.
There are two roads that you can take.  The road to your west
will take you to a military base and the one to your south will
lead you towards the fortified royal palace.

rooms.Name: a path leading to the grand Martian military base
rooms.Description:
The path is paved and even just like the rest of the roads here
in the southern part of the Martian City.  You're headed towards
a military base where there are soldiers everywhere.  To protect
their military secrets they will do anything to stop you.  If you
make it to the base, the military attack force will find you and
execute you immediately.  The path to the military base continues
west of here.

rooms.Name: a path to the Martian military base
rooms.Description:
You're getting closer to the large military base.  You can see
hundreds of green-skin Martians training their butts off.  You
can see strange aerial crafts flying high above you.  There are
large strange-looking terrain vehicles moving in and out of the 
base.  To your west, you can see several guards at a distance.  
They're obviously guarding the entrance to the top-secret military
base.  Watch out!  They look hostile.

rooms.Name: inside the top-secret Martian military base
rooms.Description:
This base is HUGE!  Everywhere you look, there are strange
armored vehicles moving around the base.  Saucer-like attack jets
zoom pass you in an amazing speed.  This is like nothing you have
seen before.  The Martian technology is centuries beyond our own.
You can hear the alarms go off as you walk across this vast
military base.  "Shoot to Kill!  Shoot to Kill!"  were the only
words you can make out from the alarm.  To the south, there's a
military training field.

rooms.Name: the entrance to the Martian military base
rooms.Description:
There are five guards here...pointing their rayguns right at you!
They're about to shoot you down if you don't run away quickly
enough.  The guards look highly trained similar to the royal guards
of Emporer Lars.  All of the soldiers here on Mars have been
trained here on this top-secret base.  The base is surrounded by
an invisible force field that nothing can penetrate.  The entire
camp is packed with new and old recruits.  They are all armed and
geared up for some reason...
There's an invisible gate to the west that only the guards can
open...and they don't seem to want to open it for you.

rooms.Name: the military training field
rooms.Description:
You're on a large training field.  There are Martian cadets here
on extensive training.  You can see the shooting range where 
soldiers practice their aim with a raygun.  There's a big, ugly
Martian standing in the middle of the field.  He looks like 
someone of high ranking because of all that brass he's wearing.
He's screaming and shouting at the poor cadets for making 
mistakes.  To your east, you see a Martian holding cell.

rooms.Name: the Martian holding cell
rooms.Description:
So this is the place where the Martians keep their war prisoners.
Some of these prisoners are their own soldiers who went AWOL. 
There are cell blocks everywhere you look.  This fortress is much
larger than Folsom Prison.  You can see the high-tech security 
cameras zooming back and forth, making sure that no prisoners is
trying to escape.  To your south, there's a large holding cell...eh,
those people inside don't look like any Martians to you...

rooms.Name: further along the Restricted path
rooms.Description:
You can hear the footsteps of soldiers hunting you down.  You're 
now a fugitive trying to find a safe hiding place.  There's 
really nowhere to run unless you go back to the city which is
south of here.  You have already been shot several times and 
luckily your armor has saved you.  This restricted path continues
north.  You can see a large, grand castle at a distance.

rooms.Name: End of the Restricted path
rooms.Description:
The castle to your east is unlike what you've seen on Earth.  It's
like a comic book dream...the castle isn't made of stone, clay,
cement, or steel girders.  This castle looks like it's entirely
covered in a red-metallic paint.  You can't describe the shape
of this massive structure -- it doesn't look like any castle made
on Earth.  To your east, uh-oh, more guards.  Oh well, you didn't
think you can just waltz into the castle without some resistance, no?

rooms.Name: Fortification -- security wall lvl.1
rooms.Description:
You come to a complete halt.  There's a security wall that blocks
you from going any further east of here.  Trained guards are
read to take you down if you try anything funny.  Scaling the 
wall will do you no good.  There's no other way to get pass the 
guards and enter the castle undetected.  Remember this is only the
1st level security wall...who knows how many walls lies beyond
this one?

rooms.Name: Fortification -- security wall lvl.2
rooms.Description:
The level 2 security wall looks much taller and stronger than the
previous wall.  There are more guards here...  You feel you're
getting closer and closer to the Martian emperor.  The guards here
are beginning to get hostile.  They have orders to kill any strangers
who has passed the first wall.

rooms.Name: Fortification -- security wall lvl.3
rooms.Description:
You're about to faint from the loss of blood during all that 
fighting.  The Martians have inflicted some serious wounds on
you.  Their powerful rayguns have proved effective against
even the strongest of armored battle-gear.  Too bad, they're
not going to give you time to rest...the guardians of this
passageway have just sense your presence and are about to attack.

rooms.Name: Fortification -- security wall lvl.4
rooms.Description:
Is this the last wall of defense?  Are there more to come?  Who
knows -- maybe the wealth in that castle is worth all this 
trouble and MORE.  There doesn't seem to be as many guards here
as the previous walls.  However, there's a guard here that's
twice the size of an average Martian.  He looks at you and smirks.
He pulls out his blaster and points it at you.  Then a voice
comes out from the giant's mouth, 'Do you feel lucky or do you,
punk?'

rooms.Name: the entrance to the Martian Castle
rooms.Description:
Look at the size of those doors!  They're made from some kind of
precious metal.  Those engraved sculptures on the door must have
took years to finish.  The large sapphire jewels that are studded
to these doors must cost millions of dollars.  The door looks
unlocked -- heh, those Martians must have thought that no one could
penetrate their defense walls.

rooms.Name: inside the Martian Castle
rooms.Description:
Wow!  This place is more glamourous than the Hilton Hotel.  The
floor is made of blue marble stones and the walls are covered
with murals.  This room is just huge and very well lit.  Those
stained glass windows down the halls are just magnificent.  This
place looks more like a museum than just a palace for a king.
There is a hallway that stretches north and south of here.

rooms.Name: a hallway to the northern section
rooms.Description:
As you walk further north of this grand castle, your eyes stayed
with the long mural on the wall.  It depicts a glorious battle
between the royal Martian army and the Saturnian invaders.  The
painting is absolutely exquisite.  The hallway continues further
north of here.

rooms.Name: end of the northern section
rooms.Description:
Finally, the hallway ends here.  There's a large soldier here 
blocking a door that'll take you east of here.  He's drinking a
bottle of vintage Martian sauce and seems unaware of your 
presence.  He looks armed and ready to shoot if there's any
trouble.  Maybe it will be wise for you to turn back now before
he senses you and sounds the alarm.

rooms.Name: the Emperor's treasure room
rooms.Description:
Oh my God!  The wealth in this room is unimaginable.  So much
gold everywhere!  It's a shame you don't have a truck here to
haul all the gold back to Earth.  Might as well just leave it
here and take the lighter stuff...remember, you might still have
to fight your way out of here!  Look inside that chest in the 
center of the room.  It looks like it contains something that's
quite important...

rooms.Name: the hallway to the southern section
rooms.Description:
The entire castle is just amazing.  The engineer who designed
this castle must have been proud of himself.  The mural on the
wall is painted all the way down this hallway.  The southern
section continues south of here.

rooms.Name: end of the southern section
rooms.Description:
The southern section of the Martian Castle ends here.  You feel
like you're just completed a tour in a grand museum.  The
artifact showcase and the murals are all reminders of the
Martian's glorious history.  There's a large spiral staircase
that'll take you to the second floor.

rooms.Name: the hallway to the Throne Room
rooms.Description:
You feel you're getting closer and closer to the Emperor.  You
can sense something is looking at you...it could be a security
camera or maybe it's a Martian hound.  You begin to sweat 
prefusely as you continue your journey to find the King.  The
hallway continues west of here.

rooms.Name: futher along the hallway
rooms.Description:
You are walking closer to the throne room and so far, you have 
not been stopped by any guards -- yet.  Is this some sort of 
a deathtrap?  Maybe you should just turn back now before it's
too late...dying here is not a good idea...

rooms.Name: a detainment cell
rooms.Description:
What's this??!!  American in a Martian holding cell?  Didn't we
have a treaty accord with Mars?  The American prisoners here 
have all been detained for petty crimes and the suspicion of
trying to spy on Martian military secrets.  You can see the  
bruises and the whip marks from the torture and beating they
sustain from the bloodthirsty Martians.  There are no exits out
of here except the one you came in from.

rooms.Name: further along the hallway
rooms.Description:
Man, will this hallway ever end?  So far, there are still no
guards here to stop you.  What are those devious Martians
planning?  They must be setting up a trap, you think to yourself,
better get out those recall scrolls just in case.  The hallway
continues west of here.

rooms.Name: A Martian Motel 6
rooms.Description:
This motel looks well-maintained and quite suitable for your
taste.  There's a little fat Martian fellow here that looks to  
be in charge of this motel.  He smiles at you and quickly offers
you a great deal on their deluxe suites.  The rates aren't that
bad, in fact, they're only 1/6 of what you would expect to pay on
Earth.  There's also free cable channels from Earth as well as
the channels from three other planets.  The room service is 
twenty-four hours and the bedding is changed daily.  Maybe you
ought to stay for a while to rest yourself.

rooms.Name: the Martian Throne Room of Emperor Lars
rooms.Description:
Oh No!  You made a big mistake!  This is not the throne room of
Lars...it's one of his many traps that he has set upon you.  The
four walls are beginning to close in on you.  As you wait for
your inevitable demise you hear a loud laughing sound.  Someone's
laughing at you from above another staircase.  You're too slow
to reach there because the walls have already begin to crush you.
Maybe, just maybe, with your superb armor and your will to
survive...you may be able to live through this and get to that
staircase to confront the man who's trying to kill you.

rooms.Name: the hallway ends here!
rooms.Description:
AAACCCKKK!!!  There is a door in all directions.  What kind of
trick is this?  What's Lars planning to do here?  Hmmm, is this
some sort of a trap?  Emperor Lars is well-knowned for his shrewd  
tactics against his enemies...  The other doors look plain compare
to the WEST door -- but the NORTH door has Martian words on it
that makes it look important.  If you don't want to make a choice
you can always turn back now.

Exits.Description: You sense there's danger through this door!
You sense there's danger through this door!
You sense there's danger through this door!
You sense there's danger through this door!
You sense there's danger through this door!
You sense there's danger through this door!
You sense there's danger through this door!

You sense there's danger through this door but something tells
you this room could lead you to the One you are looking for...
You sense there's danger through this door!

rooms.Name: the Martian Throne Room of Emperor Lars
rooms.Description:
Yikes!!!  As you walk into this room the door slams shut from
behind.  You're trapped and the four walls are closing in on you.
There's nowhere to run...you will die in a matter of seconds...
say your prayers, fool!
** If you are lucky to have survive this clever deathtrap then
you are worthy to live according to Emperor Lars.  The Emperor
admires a strong, powerful adversary.  You must go back to your
own planet and never ever set foot on Mars again!

rooms.Name: the Martian Throne Room of Emperor Lars
rooms.Description:
You're tire, hurt, and confuse.  Emperor Lars' clever trap has 
worked perfectly.  You are lucky to reach into the actual throne
room of the Martian Emperor...but so what?  Do you actually 
believe you can hurt the Emperor?  Lars has fought countless 
battles against tougher oppositions.  He has single-handedly 
defeated a small army with his powerful weapon -- the atomic
deathray.  No one, no man has ever defeated this conqueror-lord
and not even you, with your superb armor and weapon, can't hurt
him.
The Emperor's wife is sitting next to him.  She's Empress Shalla
and boy, she's quite attractive!

rooms.Name: the Secret Treasure Room of Emperor Lars
rooms.Description:
Gold, silver, rare metals, precious emeralds and jewels --
everywhere in this room!  The wealth in this room is incredible.
There's enough wealth in this boom to buy Canada and all of South
America.  Lars must have made a substantial profit from this 
tourist deal with the Outworlders.  There's a treasure chest in
the corner of this room that's locked.  Hmmm, you think to 
yourself, who's got the key?

rooms.Name: the Martian dune
rooms.Description:
A lot of sand, rock, and mountains -- those are the only things
you'll find out here in the Martian dune.  What else do you expect
to find here, you fool?  This area of Mars is an unexplored territory
-- who knows what could be lurking around the desertland.  Plus there
are countless sandtraps in this area and many explorers have been
known to be lost here.  You might want to think twice before going
any further.  There's a path in all directions.  Good luck on finding
something, whatever that may be.

Exits.Description: There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!
There's a sandtrap there that'll swallow you up!

rooms.Name: the Martian dune
rooms.Description:
There's nothing here, no wind blowing sand at your face and no
little critters crawling on your feet.  There's no sign of life
anywhere on this area of Mars.

Exits.Description: There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!
There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!
There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!

ExtraDescs.Description: There's a sandtrap there ready to swallow you up!

rooms.Name: the Martian dune
rooms.Description:
There's nothing here, no wind blowing sand at your face and no
little critters crawling on your feet.  There's no sign of life
anywhere on this area of Mars.

Exits.Description: There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!
There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!
There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!

ExtraDescs.Description: There's a sandtrap there that'll swall you up!

rooms.Name: the Martian dune
rooms.Description:
There's nothing here, no wind blowing sand at your face and no
little critters crawling on your feet.  There's no sign of life
anywhere on this area of Mars.

Exits.Description: There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!

ExtraDescs.Description: There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!

rooms.Name: the Martian dune
rooms.Description:
Uh-oh!  A large creature has just block your path and it doesn't
look friendly.  It has razor-sharp tentacles and a skin that
looks pretty tough to penetrate.  It has sharp metal plates on
its back and a tail that's protected by long spikes.  The beast
is huge, about 10' tall and he looks as though he hasn't eaten in
months.  You can sense the creature is looking right at you --
there's a small puddle of drool from where it's standing.  It
looks like it's dinner time for the creature.

Exits.Description: There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!
There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!
There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!
There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!
There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!
There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!
There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!

ExtraDescs.Description: There's a sandtrap there that'll swallow you up!

rooms.Name: the Martian dune
rooms.Description:
There's nothing here, no wind blowing sand at your face and no 
little critters crawling on your feet. There's no sign of life 
anywhere on this area of Mars.
Suddenly, you feel vibrations beneath you.  There's something
living underground...but what?

Exits.Description: There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!
There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!
There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!
There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!
There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!

ExtraDescs.Description: There's a sandtrap there that'll swallow you up!
There's a sandtrap there that'll swallow you up!

rooms.Name: the Martian dune
rooms.Description:
There's nothing here, no wind blowing sand at your face and no
little critters crawling on your feet.  There's no sign of life
anywhere on this area of Mars.

Exits.Description: There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!
There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!

rooms.Name: the Martian dune
rooms.Description:
You're tire and thirsty from all that walk across the dune.  You
feel like you're about to faint from the fatigue.  As you walk
further into this desertland, you notice a traveler from a
distance.  Could this be a mirage?

Exits.Description: There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!
There's a sandtrap there that'll swallow you up!
There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!
There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!

ExtraDescs.Description: There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!

rooms.Name: the Martian dune
rooms.Description:
There's nothing here, no wind blowing sand to your face and no
little critters crawling on your feet.  There's no sign of life
anywhere on this area of Mars.  However, at a distance, you can
see a small hut northwest of here.  Maybe there's someone living
in there.

Exits.Description: There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!
There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!

rooms.Name: a small hut
rooms.Description:
As you walk into this hut, a dark, husky Martian places his
sword at your neck.  He asks you, 'Who are you?  What's your
business here?'  As you begin answering his questions, you notice
how this room is stocked with food and water that could last for
years.  This Martian is probably some hermit hiding away from
civilization.  He must be an expert fighter because he carries a
sword rather than a phaser or a disruptor.  The Martian is 
wearing a lot of armor as though he's planning a war of some 
sort.  You can feel the blood trickling down your hands as he
presses his sword closer and closer to your throat.  This would
be a great time to break away and flee!

rooms.Name: the Martian dune
rooms.Description:
Your journey seems endless...everywhere you look there are sand,
rocks and mountains.  Egads!  Suddenly you feel something is 
pulling you underground.  You're being swallow up by a sandtrap!
You can't run or move.  You scream for help but there's no one
here that can save you.  The sandtrap is quickly engulfing you...
you begin to faint into unconsciousness...

Sorry, Outworlder, your journey ends here.

rooms.Name: the road to the Martian City
rooms.Description:
The road to the Martian City stretches all the way north.  You
can see travelers and merchants bringing their precious cargoes
to the city to sell and trade.  Everyone here looks happy and 
busy with their activities.  As you walk towards the city you can
hear from a distance, the busy merchants and traders dealing with
their customers.

rooms.Name: along the road to the Martian City
rooms.Description:
There are a lot of activities going on in the city.  Even on the
path to the city, there are traders here trying to sell you some 
of their goods.  You can hear the float-carts passing you by as
they haul a new shipment of goods.  The Martian police are here
constantly waving and saying, 'Good day, sir, shop well.'

rooms.Name: not far from the Martian City
rooms.Description:
The Martians are really an amazing race.  They seem to have a
solution for all problems like world hunger, overpopulation, the
distribution of wealth, prejudice, and the many other problems
that have plagued our planet Earth.  Emperor Lars of Mars is 
really the man responsible for all this prosperity -- he should
be given TEN noble peace prizes for his contributions to Mars.
The Martian City is not far from the point where you are standing.
You can see the tall buildings and the monuments cluster together
like a patch of weed on hard soil.  The entire city is protected
by a strong steel-thick wall.  There's no way for invaders such
as the Saturnians or the Dalaxians to break through the city walls.
The Martian City is also well guarded by trained soldiers and
policemen so even if the invaders manage to break through the
tough barrier, they would have to face these Martian defenders.

rooms.Name: the gates to the Martian City
rooms.Description:
You've arrived at the main gates to the city.  There are two large
sentinel guards here frisking anyone who wants to pass through
the gates.  One of guards tells you, 'Good day, Outworlder, mind
if I search you?  It'll only take a minute.'  You were smart to
have hidden your weapon before you've reached the city gates...
the guards would've incarcerated you and thrown you into a Martian
prison.  Finally the guard has finish his search.  He says, 'Enjoy
your stay here, shop well.'  The marketplace is north of where 
you are standing.

rooms.Name: the marketplace in the Martian City
rooms.Description:
There is a lot of activities going on in this market.  You can
see merchants and traders scampering back and forth trying to
make a deal with customers.  There are little Martian children
here running down the streets playing tag.  The city always seems
to be so lively everywhere you go.  The marketplace continues
north and east of here.

rooms.Name: the marketplace in the Martian City
rooms.Description:
As you walk around this marketplace trying to figure out where
you are, you notice a Martian bar to your north.  Hmmm,  this
would be a good time for a brewsky, you think to yourself.
You've been walking in the city for hours, you must feel a little
tire and thirsty.  The marketplace continues east and west.

rooms.Name: Welcome to the Martian City!
rooms.Description:
So this is the Martian City, it's everything you've expected and 
more.  The streets are crowded with merchants and traders.  You
can hear the loud auctioning of goods between customers and 
sellers.  There are hovering passenger buses flying over your
head and Martian policeman with jet-packs patrolling the city
from the sky.  You can see buildings and shops everywhere in the
city.  Aggressive merchants constantly pull you toward their 
shops to solicit their goods.  The busy marketplace continues 
east and west of here.  There's a nice Martian restaurant to your
north -- go there and try their exotic cuisine.

rooms.Name: the marketplace in the Martian City
rooms.Description:
The streets are much too crowded.  The merchants are trying to 
solicit you and the rest are just bumping and pushing at you.
There's a convience store to the north of here.  Maybe going in
there will get you away from all this pushing and shoving.  The
marketplace continues east and west of here.

rooms.Name: the marketplace in the Martian City
rooms.Description:
There are dealers and merchants here setting up their shops on
the both sides of the road.  You can see the other tourists
looking around this city with fascination.  It seems all the
tourists here have a camera and a lot of cash to spend.  The
marketplace continues north and west of here.

rooms.Name: the marketplace in the Martian City
rooms.Description:
As you walk along the streets of the Martian City you notice that
everyone here seems happy.  And why shouldn't they be happy?
There are rarely any crimes in the city and the tax rate here is
nil.  That means the items sold here are not taxed and the 
citizens of Mars do not have to pay a dime to the government.
Don't you wish you could live here on Mars?

rooms.Name: the marketplace in the Martian City
rooms.Description:
You're walking towards the northern area of this large city and
so far, you find Mars to be everything you dreamed of.  The 
buildings are so well constructed and it's nothing like anything
you seen on Earth.  As you walk further north, you notice an
antique shop to your west.  It would be a great place to go if
you want to buy a souvenir.

rooms.Name: the marketplace in the Martian City
rooms.Description:
You're on the northwestern section of the Martian City.  The
streets are still crowded with merchants, traders, tourist, etc.
Everywhere you look there's a business transaction of some sort
happening.  The marketplace continues north and south of here.

rooms.Name: the marketplace in the Martian City
rooms.Description:
The streets of this city are well-paved for walking but still
you're getting tired from the long walk.  There's a hotel close
to your location, maybe you should check-in there and head back
home in the morning.  The marketplace continues west and south.

rooms.Name: the marketplace in the Martian City
rooms.Description:
As you walk towards this area of the city, you notice a shop
south of here.  It looks like an appliance store which sells
state-of-the-art home appliances.  The items displayed at the
shop's window look like a good deal and plus you can't find 
anything like those on Earth.  The marketplace continues east 
and west of here.

rooms.Name: the marketplace in the Martian City
rooms.Description:
There are so many places to go in the Martian City that you may
not be able to visit them all in a day.  As you walk along this
section of the city, you notice to your north a path that'll take
you to the Universal Church of the Creator.  If you want to be a
new convert, please go there.  To your south, there's a motel 
where you can rest those tired legs of yours.  The marketplace
continues east and west of here.

rooms.Name: the marketplace in the Martian City
rooms.Description:
As you walk into this area of the city, you notice a bookstore to
your south.  It seems the only books they have for sale are books
in the Martian language and being illiterate in that language,
you might as well not visit there.  The bookstore looks packed 
with Martians...hmmm, there must be a book signing.  The marketplace
continues east and west.

rooms.Name: the marketplace in the Martian City
rooms.Description:
You've arrived at the northwestern part of the city.  There are
more merchants and dealers here trying to sell you their goods,
and their shops are all bunched up on the roadside.  The 
marketplace continues south and east of here.

rooms.Name: the marketplace in the Martian City
rooms.Description:
You're headed towards the northwestern section of the city and
your feet are beginning to get tired.  Maybe you should have
taken the hover-bus instead of having to walk around this vast
city.  The marketplace continues north and south of here.

rooms.Name: the marketplace in the Martian City
rooms.Description:
As you walk along the marketplace, you notice there's a Martian
police station to the east and there are hover police vehicles
parked all around it.  The Martian sentinels must be bored by the
lack of criminal activities here on Mars.  If you need to report
a crime, you ought to go there.  The marketplace continues north
and south of here.

rooms.Name: the marketplace in the Martian City
rooms.Description:
The merchants and dealers have set up their stands at both sides
of the street.  They're shouting out the good deals that they have
to every passing person and offering them a bargain discount.  The
marketplace continues north and south.

rooms.Name: a K-Mart on Mars
rooms.Description:
This store has become the most popular place on the planet.    
K-Mart is a great place to buy exotic items that are not found on
Mars.  The Puma shoes are the most popular footwear here and the    
Jaclyn Smith collection is popular with the ladies.  They also
have a special on the submarine sandwich and the Icee combo.  The
blue-light special is also something to look out for...items
could be up to 1/3 off *gasp*.  Yup, K-Mart has everything you
will ever need and soon they'll expand to Saturn and heck, maybe
Pluto as well.

rooms.Name: Sym's Antique Shop
rooms.Description:
Just as you step into this room a little green-skinned Martian
welcomes you to his shop.  He shows you around his little antique
shop and offers you some suggestions about buying rare Martian
antiques.  Then he begins helping you select the items that (in
his opinion) was what you needed.  You are now carrying an
armload of worthless junk and you can't drop them without 
disappointing this friendly shopkeeper.  Oh well, you might as
well buy them, you haven't spent any money so far during this trip.

rooms.Name: K'Cus Sn'amuh -- a Martian appliance store
rooms.Description:
Holy Mackeral!  This store has everything you will ever need back
home.  Look at those holo-screen televisions and the universal-
channel radios.  The place is packed with tourists trying to buy
the items they can never get on Earth.  Everything here's on sale
and plus there's no tax included in any purchase.  The items are
a steal and it's a shame you can't carry any of these back home.
There's a Martian salesman here trying to process everyone's
order and he looks very, very busy.

rooms.Name: Soto's Martian Bookstore
rooms.Description:
The place is packed with Martians!  What's the deal?  Is there a
poetry reading or maybe a book signing by some famous author?  As
you push your way forward through the crowd, you finally found
your way to the guest tables.  Oh my God!  That's George Takai
and he's autographing his new book (which was translated in 
Martian!).  No wonder this place is packed, everyone here is a
trekker...err trekkie, whichever.  The line looks pretty long,
maybe you can get his autograph some other day.

rooms.Name: the Martian dune
rooms.Description:
There's nothing here, no wind blowing sand at your face and no
little critters crawling on your feet.  There's no sign of life
anywhere on this area of Mars.

Exits.Description: There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!
There's a santrap that'll swallow you up!
There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!

ExtraDescs.Description: There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!
There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!
There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!

rooms.Name: Martian Police Department
rooms.Description:
Wow!  There's more pigs here than the slaughter house down the
block.  The policemen here are just looking through files and
giving safety tips to people over the telecom.  The jail cell
looks empty and you don't see any thugs or punks being brought
in for questioning.  This PD is unlike the ones we have back on 
Earth.  Everything here looks orderly and clean.  No one here is
sleeping on the job and every officer looks fit to serve this 
department.  There's a tall Martian police chief here sitting
by the counter.  He asks you, 'May I help you, m'ucs ht'rae?'

rooms.Name: Taan's Cocktail and Pleasure Palace
rooms.Description:
Oops!  You had no idea this is a strip bar.  You can see the
half-naked showgirls dancing on a platform and asking patrons if
they wanted a lap-dance.  This place looks quite sleazy and you 
wonder why the Martian counsel would allow such a place to exist.
There are off-duty cops here sitting down on the tables, drinking a
few brews and enjoying the show.  Everyone who are close to the 
platform are clipping money to the dancer's thong.  Oh well, might
as well enjoy yourself a brew if you're not going to watch the
show.  There's a bartender here to service your every need.

rooms.Name: Ravik's Martian Smorgasbord
rooms.Description:
As you walk into this restaurant the first thing you notice is
the awful stench in this room.  Egads!  That 'stench' comes from
the food they're serving here.  You want to vomit from just
watching the line of foods they have at the self-serve tables.  
You had no idea the Martian enjoys eating raw flesh and entrails.

     "G'nilthrae dipu'ts, how do you do?  Welcome to my
      restaurant, how may I serve you?'

The restaurant owner, Ravik, is here to serve you.  He looks  
friendly and sincere.

rooms.Name: a path to the Universal Church of the Creator
rooms.Description:
You decided you wanted to check out this new Martian church.  The
path you're standing on is made of soft clay and it's a comfort to
walk on unlike the harder concrete roads.  At a distance, north
of here, you can see the grand church.  You're dazzled by the
large metallic structure and it's unexplainable, unique design.
This church is definitely unlike any you'd find on Earth.  The
entrance to the church is just north of here.

rooms.Name: the entrance to the Universal Church of the Creator
rooms.Description:
The doors to the church are just massive and they're studded with
the rarest of jewels.  You can see large monuments of conquerors
and kings lined up side by side towards the two large doors.  As
you try walking towards the entrance, there's a guard here 
blocking your path.  He says, 'Sorry Outworlder, this is no place
for a tourist, please turn back immediately.'  The big Martian
guard sounded serious.  Maybe you should heed his warning and just
leave -- you don't want to make any trouble here, do you?

rooms.Name: inside the Universal Church of the Creator
rooms.Description:
You are now inside the Martian's holy grounds and you gasp as you
look around this mammoth complex.  The church is huge and you can
hear strange music being played all around.  The hand-crafted, 
stained glass windows are just magnificent.  The pillars that 
support the painted ceiling are made of fine, blue marble.  The
floor is plastered with mosaic tiles -- perhaps constructing an
image of the all-powerful Creator.  There are more than a hundred 
row of seats in this section alone.  The broad aisle in the center
will take you further towards the front rows.

rooms.Name: inside the Universal Church of the Creator
rooms.Description:
You're walking down the aisle and passing by the worshippers here
who are praying to the one known as the Creator.  The preists are
here as well, to worship their god.  As you walk along the aisle
you notice ahead of you is a large holy symbol that stands for
'God'.  The lights are quite dim and the smell of incense is 
becoming nauseating.  You're getting closer to the holy water
fountain at the altar which if north of you.

rooms.Name: the altar at the Universal Church of the Creator
rooms.Description:
There's a large fountain here and it's bubbling with fresh holy
water.  You're standing in front of several hundred worshippers
praying at your direction, and you're just standing there 
enjoying it.  The worshippers are half-asleep in their prayers
and they don't even know you're up there.
To your east there's a prayer room -- a bright light coming from
that direction.  And to the west there's a wooden door that'll
take you inside a sacred room.

rooms.Name: the room of the Divine One
rooms.Description:
This room is pretty small and it's poorly furnished.  The chairs
and tables look like they're about to break apart.  The mattress
and bedding look pretty soiled.  The room is dusty and there's
not a lot of fresh air in here.  There's no ventilating shafts
anywhere located in this room.  The restroom is obviously that
smelly tin bucket next to the bed.  As you look at the far corner
of this room you'll notice a priest is here reciting a bible.  He
looks like he's really into his studies that he didn't notice you
entered his room.

rooms.Name: the room of penance
rooms.Description:
You've walked into the room of penance where you must be punish
by the Creator for past wrong-doings.  This large statue of the
Creator was givin life by the holy Creator to punish those who
had sinned in the mortal world.  You have admitted to your sins
by just coming into this room and now you will die.  The statue
is merciless when it comes to punishment.  No Martians has ever
survived the physical pain that the statue inflicts.

rooms.Name: the Martian dune
rooms.Description:
There's nothing here, no wind blowing sand at your face and no
little critters crawling on your feet.  There's no sign of life
anywhere on this area of Mars.

Exits.Description: There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!
There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!

ExtraDescs.Description: There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!
There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!

rooms.Name: the Martian dune
rooms.Description:
There's nothing here, no wind blowing sand at your face and no
little critters crawling on your feet.  There's no sign of life
anywhere on this area of Mars.

Exits.Description: There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!
There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!
There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!

ExtraDescs.Description: There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!
There's a sandtrap that'll swallow you up!
There's a sandtrap there ready to swallow you up!

rooms.Name: On the Red Planet -- Mars!
rooms.Description:
Holy Cow!  When the Traveler said 'afar' he really meant it!
You've landed on the planet Mars and surprisely you're still
alive.  The atmosphere here cannot possibly sustain human life
and yet something must be keeping your head from exploding.  Maybe
it's the Traveler's great power that's keeping you alive...
You're standing on a surface much like the clay courts at the 
French Open.  Everywhere you look there are mountains, rocks, and
sand dunes.  The sky is unlike anything on Earth -- it's dark and
frightening!  This place looks more like Hell than a planet.
Where will you go from here, you wonder to yourself.  There are
four directions that you can take.  Read the sign post if you
aren't sure where you'd want to go.
There's an old sign post here...(GLOWING)

ExtraDescs.Description:
*  Visit our friendly shopkeepers, restaurant owners, and hotel
   managers.  Go NORTH and you will find our beautiful Martian City.
*  To the WEST, there is nothing...just a lot of sand dunes and
   desert lands.  For centuries, we have not explore this area on
   Mars.  It is highly unrecommended that you go there.  There 
   are sandtraps that are hidden everywhere...
*  If you like to go sight seeing, we suggest you go EAST and
   visit the Martian mines.  You can witness how we mine our 
   precious mineral resources.  Warning to all tourists:  Please
   do not wander into any unexplore caves in that area.
*  It is forbidden for anyone to go SOUTH of here unless of
   course, you are an official of the Martian Counsel or a
   military officer of our prestigious army.  Trespassers will
   be sentenced to IMMEDIATE DEATH!  We will protect our emperor
   with extreme measures, so be warned.

rooms.Name: a NASA station
rooms.Description:
What the heck do you think you're doing walking in here?  This
place is restricted to civilians.  You can hear the security 
cameras turning to your direction.  The alarms begin to sound and
the NASA security guards are headed your way.  You got nowhere
to go, nowhere to run.  The main door from where you enter has
been automatically closed and cannot be reopened.  You think
to yourself -- hmmm, mind as well just look around, the guards
wouldn't catch up to me that quickly.  As you walk along the
halls, you notice a strange-looking man standing next to a large
window.  He doesn't look like he works here and his outfit...it
seems to glow as though it has been bombarded with lethal 
radiation.  Suddenly...the stranger looks at you.  He smiles and 
then asks you, 'Want to go where no man has gone before?  Give
me some money and I'll send you afar!'
